H0.text: Allopolyploids are the cultivated forms of wheat, cotton, and tobacco plants.

H1.text: Pores are the cultivated forms of wheat, cotton, and tobacco plants.

H2.text: Sporozoans are the cultivated forms of wheat, cotton, and tobacco plants.

H3.text: Bales are the cultivated forms of wheat, cotton, and tobacco plants.

A4.text: Both bread wheat and triticale are examples of an allopolyploids with six chromosome sets.

A5.text: cotton, peanut, and quinoa are allotetraploids with multiple origins.
